intro: Campylospermum obtusifolium f. uniracemosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with small white or pink flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
